title: Nuggets steal G1 in OKC on 2nd Gordon winner
content: Nikola Jokic had 42 points and 22 rebounds, and Aaron Gordon hit a 3-pointer in the closing seconds to give the Nuggets a stunning 121-119 comeback win over the top-seeded Thunder on Monday night in Game 1 of their Western Conference semifinal series.

title: Isles win draft lottery for first time since '09
content: The New York Islanders won the NHL draft lottery on Monday and vaulted nine teams -- including the last-place San Jose Sharks -- in winning the opportunity to have the No. 1 pick, marking the first time the franchise will have that position since 2009.

title: Ravens make 'tough decision,' cut kicker Tucker
content: The Ravens on Monday released kicker Justin Tucker, parting ways with the NFL's most accurate kicker who is being investigated by the league for sexual misconduct.

title: Atkinson wins Coach of Year in debut with Cavs
content: Cleveland's Kenny Atkinson, who watched from the sideline as Donovan Mitchell, Darius Garland and Evan Mobley had All-Star seasons for the Cavaliers, has been named the NBA Coach of the Year after leading the team to 64 wins and the top seed in the East.

title: Man takes 1st steps after 21-foot fall at PNC Park
content: The 20-year-old man who fell from the top of a 21-foot-high wall onto the warning track at PNC Park during a Pirates game last week took his first steps Monday, but he still has "a long way to go" in his recovery.

title: Top 2026 QB Curtis chooses Georgia over Oregon
content: Five-star passer Jared Curtis, the No. 1 quarterback in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to the Georgia Bulldogs over the Oregon Ducks Monday night, closing a fierce recruiting battle that sources told ESPN's Eli Lederman went "down to the wire."

title: Yankees' Cole on surgery: 'Starts out really dark'
content: Yankees pitcher Gerrit Cole said his mind is on clearing checkpoints in his recovery from elbow reconstruction surgery last month.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: Reshuffling all 32 teams after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: NFL experts debate the draft: What were the best -- and most puzzling -- picks?
content: Great value on Malaki Starks? Reach on Isaac TeSlaa? We asked 17 experts to weigh in on the NFL draft.

title: Five-star QB Jared Curtis to Georgia: How he fits and what's next
content: Jared Curtis, the nation's top QB recruit has made his decision. Here's what the move means for the teams and the 2026 class.

title: Who will kick for Ravens after Justin Tucker release? A look at his likely successor
content: After drafting the Arizona kicker in the sixth round, the team will likely turn to Tyler Loop after releasing Tucker on Monday.

title: Chelsea-Liverpool lessons, Napoli close to Serie A title, Bayern clinch Bundesliga, more
content: Chelsea beat Liverpool, Napoli moved closer to another Serie A title, and Bayern Munich clinched the Bundesliga without playing: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Sources: Madrid want Alexander-Arnold for CWC
content: Real Madrid want Trent Alexander-Arnold to join them for this summer's Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN, and now plan talks with Liverpool to negotiate his early release.

title: Arteta: 'Have to give your life' to reach final
content: Mikel Arteta has said Arsenal need to be ready to give their life to reach the Champions League final.

title: Kane targets trophy 'number two' after title win
content: England striker Harry Kane said it feels sweet to finally end his career-long trophy drought after securing the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich

title: Mourinho silent on future as Fener title hopes fade
content: José Mourinho refused to confirm whether he will remain at Fenerbahce next season after Sunday's defeat to Besiktas left them adrift in the title race.

title: Racing's Borges gets 3-match ban for ref push
content: Racing Louisville FC midfielder Ary Borges has been suspended for an additional three matches for pushing the center referee after a recent match.

title: Kroos: Pedri 'more important' to Barça than Yamal
content: Former Real Madrid player Toni Kroos believes Barcelona's Pedri is the best midfielder in the world and more important to his team than Lamine Yamal, Robert Lewandowski and Raphinha.

title: Mac Allister: Liverpool 'just getting started'
content: Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister hopes winning the Premier League title this season is "just the beginning of something great."

title: CAS to rule in León's Club World Cup dispute
content: A verdict is expected Tuesday in Liga MX club León's legal dispute with FIFA over entry to the Club World Cup in the United States next month.

title: Hamilton Miami radio drama born out of Ferrari's lack of pace
content: Lewis Hamilton's radio messages weren't Ferrari's biggest problem in Miami, it was the middling performance.

title: Miami GP showcases F1's youth movement, American popularity
content: From the drivers in the cars to the fans in the stands, young people made F1's Miami GP yet another success.

title: A.J. Brown's proposal to girlfriend includes performance by John Legend
content: The Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver will don his second ring in a several month stretch after helping the Eagles win Super Bowl LIX in February.

title: Overhyped and underdelivered: Only one fighter gets an A from highly anticipated weekend
content: From Ryan Garcia to Naoya Inoue, Andreas Hale looks at the top fighters to compete last weekend and grades their performances.

title: West Virginia football unveils throwback uniforms that pay homage to 1965 team
content: The threads, unveiled Monday, will feature tweaks to the team's usual color scheme and a modern version of the helmets worn by the 1965 squad.

title: Grading MLB's City Connect uniforms: Snakes launch best look of 2025
content: From the pastel Padres to the Motor City Tigers and beyond, we break down MLB's City Connect uniforms.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers, Stars are favorites to hoist Cup
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Kirst, Kavanagh or English? Paul Carcaterra's big board for the 2025 PLL draft
content: ESPN's Paul Carcaterra ranks the 2025 PLL draft's top prospects and matches teams up with players who best fit their needs.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Waiver wire: Why settle for one rising star when you can have two?
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: MLS: Vancouver remain top; Seattle, Philadelphia soar up
content: The Vancouver Whitecaps continue to dominate the top spot in the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eyeing move for Sané
content: Barcelona are reportedly looking to sign Leroy Sané when his contract expires. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Pakistan's grandstanding flops again': UNSC meet yields no outcome
content: The United Nations Security Council convened closed-door consultations on Monday to address the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, following a warning from secretary-general António Guterres about the deteriorating relations. The meeting was prompted by the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in the deaths of 26 civilians.

title: Families of IPS, I-T officers clash over seat at Diamond Box during RCB match
content: During an IPL match between RCB and CSK in Bengaluru, a heated dispute erupted in the Diamond Box between the families of a senior Indian Police Service officer and an income tax commissioner over their seating arrangements. The argument escalated, leading to allegations of intimidation, sexual harassment, and outraging modesty.

title: ‘It’s a boy’: Israeli soldiers blow up Gaza building in viral gender reveal video
content: Israeli soldiers sparked outrage after a video surfaced showing them destroying a building in Gaza for a 'gender reveal party,' celebrating the birth of a boy with blue smoke. This occurred amidst escalating military actions, including a controversial plan approved by Prime Minister Netanyahu to capture and control the entire Gaza Strip indefinitely, potentially displacing hundreds of thousands of Palestinians.

title: Ray Dalio, the man who predicted 2008 recession, says Trump Tariff pushing US to recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: IPL Playoff Scenarios: SRH exit, DC in hunt; how important is GT vs MI?
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad's IPL playoff hopes were dashed after a washout, while Delhi Capitals gained a point, keeping their top-two aspirations alive. The result puts pressure on LSG, needing wins in their remaining games. DC's playoff chances hinge on their upcoming matches against PBKS, GT, and MI, with various scenarios determining their fate.

title: Pak violates ceasefire along LoC for 12th day, Army responds in 'proportionate' manner
content: Tensions escalate along the Line of Control as Pakistani troops initiated unprovoked firing in eight forward areas of Jammu and Kashmir, marking the 12th consecutive night of ceasefire violations. This follows the Pahalgam terror attack, prompting a strong response from Indian forces.

title: Amazon is changing its salary structure, here's who the new guidelines favour
content: Amazon is revamping its compensation strategy, rewarding veteran top performers with up to 110% of their pay range for consistent excellence over four years. First-time high achievers and those with fluctuating performance will see reduced payouts.

title: Uncapped, Unfazed, Unmatched! India’s young batters blaze IPL 2025
content: IPL 2025 witnesses the emergence of exciting uncapped Indian opening batters, showcasing their talent and potential. Ayush Mhatre, Abishek Porel, Priyansh Arya, Prabhsimran Singh, and Vaibhav Suryavanshi have impressed with their explosive performances. Suryavanshi, at just 14, became the youngest T20 centurion, while others like Arya have displayed dynamic strokeplay, offering a glimpse into the future of Indian cricket.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex above 80,700
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was near 24,450, BSE Sensex was above 80,700.

title: Bill Gates writes 'Congratulations' message for Warren Buffet: 'My life changed…
content: Bill Gates has lauded Warren Buffett as a mentor, friend, and one of history's greatest investors and philanthropists, following Berkshire Hathaway's shareholder meeting. Gates emphasized Buffett's profound impact on his life, highlighting his integrity, humor, and generosity. He also acknowledged Buffett's legacy of inspiring future generations through both business acumen and philanthropic endeavors, noting their 30-year friendship and collaborative efforts.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on Twitter; changes his profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Israel launches airstrikes in Yemen after missile lands near Tel Aviv
content: Israel launched airstrikes on Yemen’s Hodeidah port Monday, injuring 21, in retaliation for a Houthi missile that landed near Tel Aviv’s Ben Gurion Airport—the first to bypass Israeli defenses. The Houthis vowed further attacks and warned airlines to avoid Israel. The escalation highlights rising regional tensions as Yemen’s Houthis intensify actions in response to Israel’s Gaza offensive.

title: 'To accommodate Dhoni ...': Gavaskar urges cap on uncapped player salaries
content: Sunil Gavaskar has expressed concerns over BCCI's decision. The board altered rules to favour MS Dhoni as an uncapped player. Gavaskar questions the high salaries for uncapped players in IPL. He believes this move could harm Indian cricket's future. Gavaskar urges BCCI to reverse the rule change. He wants to limit salaries for uncapped players.

title: Ajaz Khan unreachable after rape case filed; Mumbai Police launch search
content: Actor Ajaz Khan, known for his appearance in 'Bigg Boss 7', is under investigation by Mumbai Police following a r*pe complaint filed against him. Authorities have been unable to reach Khan since the FIR was lodged at Charkop Police Station, as his phone is switched off and he is not at his residence.

title: India prepares dams to store more water, lines up multiple actions to choke Pakistan
content: Following the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty, India has initiated flushing and desilting of reservoirs on the Chenab River to improve water storage for the winter months. This action is part of a broader strategy to regulate the flow of western rivers into Pakistan. India also plans to expedite hydropower projects and explore additional measures to maximize water utilization.

title: Two Indian children missing as migrant boat capsizes off California, 3 dead
content: A migrant boat capsized off the coast of San Diego, resulting in three fatalities, four injuries, and seven missing individuals. Among those affected is an Indian family, with two children still unaccounted for. The US Coast Guard is actively searching for the missing, while the Consulate General of India is providing assistance to the family.

title: 'Aap karo toh dance …': Surya & Rashid's banter ft. Siraj - Watch!
content: Ahead of their crucial IPL 2025 clash, Mumbai Indians' Suryakumar Yadav and Gujarat Titans' Rashid Khan engaged in playful banter, delighting fans. Rashid inquired about Surya's 'Supla' shot, to which Surya responded with a humorous jab about Rashid's 'snake shot'. Mohammed Siraj joined in the laughter, creating a lighthearted moment.

title: Warren Buffet: I am somewhat embarrassed to say Apple CEO …
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, acknowledged Tim Cook's role in Berkshire Hathaway's success. He credited Apple's CEO for significant financial gains. Buffett announced his retirement at the annual meeting. This marked the end of an era. Greg Abel, the vice chairman, is set to succeed Buffett. Abel will lead Berkshire with a focus on long-term value.

title: Met Gala: Serena, Hamilton, Biles dazzle as athletes walk down red carpet
content: The 2025 Met Gala, celebrating "Superfine: Tailoring Black Style," saw athletes joining celebrities in bespoke fashions. Lewis Hamilton co-chaired, while LeBron James missed it due to injury. Simone Biles, Angel Reese, Serena and Venus Williams, Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, Sha'carri Richardson, and WNBA stars graced the event.

title: Pakistani hackers claim to have breached many Indian defence sites
content: Cyber-attacks originating from Pakistan have escalated, targeting Indian defense entities. The website of Armoured Vehicles Nigam Limited (AVNL) was defaced, and hackers claim to have accessed sensitive data from the Military Engineering Services (MES) and MP-IDSA. Authorities are taking measures to bolster security, audit systems, and enhance digital defenses against further intrusions.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for May 6, 2025
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests buying Aurobindo Pharma, anticipating a breakout from a flag pattern with a target of Rs 1356, and IRCTC, expecting an upward trend to Rs 802 after breaking consolidation.

title: IPL match today, MI vs GT: All you need to know
content: Mumbai Indians and Gujarat Titans face off in a crucial IPL 2025 match, both vying for playoff berths. MI, on a six-game winning streak, needs two more wins to secure qualification. GT's strong top order, featuring Sudharsan, Buttler and Gill, will be tested by MI's bowling attack, spearheaded by Boult and Bumrah.

title: Trump blocks Harvard's billion-dollar funding, demands sweeping overhaul
content: The Trump administration has barred Harvard University from receiving new federal research grants, escalating a dispute over antisemitism, academic standards, and campus management. Education Secretary Linda McMahon accused Harvard of violating legal duties, citing concerns over protests, foreign student admissions, and DEI initiatives. Harvard has responded with a lawsuit, alleging government overreach and infringement of First Amendment rights.

title: Rahul Vaidya takes indirect dig at Virat Kohli amid his controversy with Avneet Kaur
content: Singer Rahul Vaidya humorously claimed Virat Kohli blocked him on Instagram, suggesting it might be an 'algorithm glitch,' indirectly referencing Kohli's recent social media activity. Kohli's fans responded with trolling, leading to Vaidya expressing frustration and calling them 'jokers,' even when the abuse extended to his family.

title: SC: Trend of ED making allegations against accused without evidence
content: The Supreme Court has raised concerns about the Enforcement Directorate (ED) making unsubstantiated allegations in money laundering cases, highlighting a pattern of lacking evidence to link accused individuals to proceeds of crime. This observation arose during a bail hearing for an accused in the Chhattisgarh liquor scam, where the court questioned the ED's evidence linking the accused to a specific amount of illicit funds.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial: CCTV footage of rapper assaulting Cassie becomes focus
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs' federal trial is underway, marked by sex trafficking, rape, and coercion charges stemming from numerous civil lawsuits alleging decades of abuse. A 2016 video showing Combs assaulting Cassie Ventura has surfaced, potentially influencing jury selection. With Combs pleading not guilty, the trial promises to be a high-profile legal battle.

title: "Shouldn't Be Considered Divisive," Mallikarjun Kharge Writes To PM On Caste Census
content: Mallikarjun Kharge has urged PM Modi to draw upon the Telangana model for the caste survey, remove 50% cap for reservation and immediately implement Article 15(5) for reservations for SCs, STs and OBCs in private educational institutions.

title: Punjab Police Foils Terror Bid; Grenades, Bombs Found In Forest Area
content: A cache of terrorist hardware, including grenades and Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) were recovered from a forest in Punjab.

title: India Pak Tensions Live Updates: 3rd Top Commander Talks Since Cross-Border Firing Today
content: India Pakistan Tensions LIVE Updates: The UN Security Council commenced closed-door consultations, hours after Secretary General Antonio Guterres voiced concern over tensions.

title: Supreme Court's Big Transparency Move, Assets Of Judges Made Public
content: In a bid to enhance transparency, the Supreme Court on Monday said it has uploaded statements of assets of judges on its website, in accordance with a full-court decision to place the relevant details in the public domain.

title: Who Is Balvinder Singh Sahni, Indian-Origin Billionaire Jailed In Dubai For Money Laundering
content: Dubai-based Indian businessman Balvinder Singh Sahni will be jailed and deported from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) for financial crimes, including money laundering.

title: Centre Asks For Security Drills In States Amid J&K Tensions, First Since 1971
content: The Centre has asked several states to conduct security mock drills on Wednesday, May 7, for "effective civil defence" amid tensions between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, sources told NDTV.

title: PM Meets Top Defence Official Amid Buzz Over India's Pahalgam Counterstrike
content: Amid speculation over how India will respond to the Pahalgam terror attack, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today met Defence Secretary Giridhar Aramane, sources have said

title: How A Defiant Harvard Reacted To Trump Ban On Federal Grants
content: The Trump administration has locked horns with Harvard, threatening budgets, tax-exempt status and enrollment of foreign students.

title: Bhuwan Ribhu Becomes First Indian Lawyer To Receive World Law Congress Honour For Child Rights
content: For over two decades, Bhuwan Ribhu's legal fight against child exploitation earned him the World Jurist Association's Medal of Honour

title: "Nonsensical": Hollywood Shocked By Trump's 100% Film Tariffs Announcement
content: Hollywood reacted Monday with skepticism to US President Donald Trump's announcement of 100 percent tariffs on foreign films, with movie insiders calling it a policy made up on the fly by a president who fails to understand how the industry works.

title: Trump Escalates Harvard Row, Bans Federal Grants For University
content: President Donald Trump's education secretary said Monday that Harvard will no longer receive federal grants, escalating an ongoing battle with the prestigious university as it challenges the funding cuts in court.

title: Pentagon Chief Orders 20% Reduction Of Four-Star Military Officers
content: Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth on Monday ordered at least a 20 percent reduction in the number of active-duty four-star generals and admirals in the US military, a memo from the defense secretary said.

title: 8 Killed, 2 Injured In Car-Tractor Collision In Bihar: Cops
content: Eight people died and two others were injured in a head-on collision between a car and a tractor in Bihar's Katihar district, police said on Tuesday.

title: Syria State TV Relaunches, Months After Assad's Ouster
content: Syrian state television officially relaunched on Monday with a trial broadcast almost five months after the ouster of longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad and following delays blamed on sanctions and dilapidated equipment.

title: Pulitzers Honour Coverage Of Trump Assassination Attempt, Gaza War
content: Coverage of the wars in Gaza and Sudan, and the attempted assassination of US President Donald Trump, dominated the Pulitzer Prizes announced Monday at Columbia University in New York.

title: Ajaz Khan's Phone Switched Off, Searching For Him: Mumbai Police
content: Actor Ajaz Khan has been booked by the Mumbai police after a woman filed a complaint in which she has accused him of rape.

title: 'Genocidal language': JD Vance blasts Ilhan Omar's call to 'profile white men'
content: Vice President JD Vance has strongly criticised Congresswoman Ilhan Omar's past remarks advocating for profiling white men, branding them as 'genocidal language.' Omar's 2018 interview, where she cited white men as the primary cause of deaths in the US, resurfaced recently.

title: 10 times the Met Gala menu was as dramatic as the outfits
content: The Met Gala, known for its fashion, also boasts exquisite culinary experiences. Past menus have featured unique dishes like black rice porcini arancini and watermelon tart with smoked yuzu soy. This year, Chef Kwame Onwuachi, celebrated for his African and Caribbean-inspired cuisine, will curate the menu.

title: Hegseth orders 20% cut in senior generals across the Pentagon
content: The Donald Trump administration is rapidly reshaping the United States military and intelligence apparatus, with Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth directing significant cuts to top-ranking officers. These reductions, impacting all military branches and intelligence agencies, aim to reduce the federal government's size and align leadership with the administration's national security agenda.

title: India to soon get 2nd advanced stealth frigate built in Russia
content: India's naval power is set to increase with the imminent commissioning of INS Tamala, a stealth frigate from Russia, following its sister ship INS Tushil. The Navy and DRDO successfully tested indigenous underwater mines, enhancing undersea warfare capabilities. These advanced Krivak-III class frigates, equipped with Brahmos missiles and other weapons, will bolster India's blue water operations.

title: Indians rush to buy the dip on Wall Street amid market chaos
content: Amidst US tariff hike proposals in April, Indian investors demonstrated savvy investment strategies by increasing their investments in overseas equities, particularly in the US. Platforms like INDMoney and HDFC Securities reported significant surges in investment activity, with a notable rise in new investors targeting US stocks. This enthusiasm was fueled by the perception of market volatility as a buying opportunity, especially in sectors like AI and tech.

title: 2-minute habit neuroscientist swears by to keep brain sharp
content: Feeling mentally foggy? A cognitive neuroscientist suggests a simple two-minute fix: a short walk. This boosts blood flow to the brain, enhancing focus and clarity. Dr. Holly Bowen recommends it for post-lunch slumps or when feeling overwhelmed, promoting alertness and sharper thinking by reducing stress hormones and increasing feel-good chemicals.

title: First since 1971: MHA orders nationwide security drills to prepare for any attack
content: Amid rising tensions with Pakistan, the Indian government has directed all states and Union Territories to conduct civil defence drills on Wednesday across 244 designated districts. This exercise aims to evaluate and enhance the preparedness of civil defence mechanisms against potential hostile attacks, evoking memories of past conflicts.

title: Elon Musk seems to have neighbourhood problem in Texas, where he ...
content: Elon Musk is embroiled in disputes with his Texas neighbors over his compound plans. Complaints include zoning violations, excessive security measures like high fences and cameras, and alleged harassment. A homeowners association head, Paul Hemmer, has been particularly vocal, claiming constant surveillance and indecent behavior accusations.

title: In call to PM Modi, Putin backs India, says no compromise on terror
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin, in a call with PM Modi, strongly condemned the Pahalgam terrorist attack, emphasizing the need to bring perpetrators and supporters to justice. This endorsement of India's stance comes amid international calls for de-escalation. Putin accepted Modi's invitation to visit India for the annual summit, reaffirming the strength and resilience of the India-Russia strategic partnership.

title: Prolonged tension to hurt Pakistan's economy: Moody's
content: Moody's Rating warns that escalating tensions with India could negatively impact Pakistan's growth, fiscal stability, and macroeconomic situation. Pakistan's weak fundamentals and reliance on IMF bailouts make it vulnerable. While Pakistan's economy shows signs of improvement, persistent tensions could strain its foreign exchange reserves and access to external financing. In contrast, India's economy is expected to remain stable, with minimal disruption due to limited economic ties with Pakistan.

title: No stay, next CJI B R Gavai to decide waqf Act validity
content: CJI Sanjiv Khanna has passed the decision on the validity of the Waqf Amendment Act, 2025 to incoming CJI B R Gavai, scheduling a hearing for May 15. The decision came after the court reviewed the Centre's response, noting the need for detailed examination of waqf property registration and related figures. The government maintains the Act benefits the Muslim community, while petitioners have raised concerns.

title: Kiara Advani debuts baby bump at her first Met Gala
content: Kiara Advani made a breathtaking debut at the 2025 Met Gala, themed “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style,” showcasing Indian excellence on fashion’s biggest global stage. In a historic moment, she became the first Indian actress to grace the Met Gala carpet with her baby bump, adding depth and symbolism to an already iconic appearance. Draped in a custom couture creation by renowned Indian designer Gaurav Gupta, Kiara’s look celebrated both her cultural roots and her personal evolution.

title: Amid Pak's reckless missile tests, Japan backs India's war on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh conveyed to his Japanese counterpart General Nakatani India's concerns regarding Pakistan's continued support for cross-border terrorism and its role in nuclear proliferation, which threatens regional stability. Both nations condemned terrorism and pledged to enhance global cooperation to counter cross-border threats, with Japan expressing solidarity with India following the Pahalgam attack.

title: Rajasthan govt plan to rename Mt Abu, ban booze and non-veg, sparks protests
content: Rajasthan government's plan to rename Mount Abu as 'Abu Raj Tirth' faces strong opposition from 23 local organizations, fearing a shift from a tourist destination to a religious site. Stakeholders worry that the proposed name change, coupled with potential restrictions on meat and alcohol, could collapse tourism and lead to mass unemployment. Concerns are rising about the hill station's identity and its attractiveness to visitors.

title: India conveys its concern to Canada over anti-Hindu rally
content: India has expressed strong concerns to Canada regarding a parade in Toronto featuring anti-India imagery and threatening language. The Indian government urges Canadian authorities to take action against anti-India elements promoting hatred, extremism, and separatism. This issue continues to strain bilateral relations despite India's willingness to collaborate with the new Canadian government.

title: Pahalgam attack should not derail governance and development in J&K: Omar
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah emphasized that the Pahalgam terror attack would not impede governance and development in Jammu and Kashmir, echoing the central government's sentiment. He resumed office in Srinagar, prioritizing action, accountability, and inclusive development. Abdullah highlighted the importance of a smooth Amarnath Yatra and the anticipated inauguration of the Kashmir rail link to boost the region.

title: UN Security Council Begins Closed-Door Talks Meeting On India-Pak Tensions
content: The UN Security Council commenced closed-door consultations here on the situation between India and Pakistan, hours after Secretary General Antonio Guterres voiced concern over tensions between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: "Refined Way Of Hawala Business": Top Court On Trading In Bitcoin In India
content: The Supreme Court on Monday said trading in Bitcoin in India is like "dealing with a refined way of Hawala business" as it lamented that the Centre has till now not come out with a clear regime on regulating virtual currency.

title: India makes Chenab run dry, for now
content: Following a terror attack and the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty, India has restricted water flow from the Baglihar and Salal dams on the Chenab River. This unprecedented action led to dramatically low water levels, allowing residents to walk across the riverbed for the first time in memory. The move highlights India's ability to regulate water resources and has sparked debate over the treaty's impact on the region.

title: NBA conference semifinals: Late surge gives Nuggets 1-0 lead over OKC
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here, and our insiders have you covered for every game of the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking home-court advantage away from the No. 1-seeded Cleveland Cavaliers with a 121-112 victory .

title: 👀 Best athlete fits at 2025 Met Gala
content: the 2025 Met Gala has officially kicked off in new york city . some of the biggest sports stars are in attendance . the gala features a strong presence behind the scenes . athletes have made headlines at the annual fundraising event in previous years .

title: The most astounding numbers of Aaron Judge's torrid start to 2025
content: Aaron Judge is hitting an astounding .423/.510/.777 with 10 extra-base hits during his eighth-inning double Sunday . he leads the majors in batting average, on-base percentage, slugging percentage, OPS and hits .

title: Knicks rally down 20, steal home court from C's
content: the new york Knicks beat the Celtics in overtime . the defending-champions were bludgeoneoned by Boston on the offensive glass . defending champions thrashed the club by 20 points in the third period .

title: 2026 recruiting class top 25 rankings: Georgia debuts after landing five-star QB
content: it has been nearly a decade since the Buckeyes have signed a top-five class . the Trojans have yet to make an appearance in the college football playoff . it is anchored by two five-star recruits, both of whom have come on board .

title: NWSL: Orlando Pride top, Naeher makes history
content: a week of NWSL action is in the books, which means it's time for ESPN's Power Rankings . our writers studied the action from across Matchday 7 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league .

title: Where all 30 MLB teams stand -- and what each of them needs to change
content: Xavier Scruggs explains why the Cubs might need to be worried about their pitching . every team, no matter how splendid or how dreadful the start, has something to change . the national league looked top-heavy, and the overall dynamic is very much one of dominance .

title: NBA playoff odds: Pacers close gap on Cavaliers after Game 1 win
content: defending champions Boston Celtics and the new york Knicks are favorites to win the Eastern Conference . early favorites for Finals MVP include Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Jayson Tatum and Donovan Mitchell . the Golden State Warriors beat the Houston Rockets on the road in Game 7 .

title: College baseball Week 12: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: Coastal Carolina jumped up five spots, making room for the USC Trojans to be ranked for the first time this season . the longhorns were swept on the road by Arkansas, and the Tigers dropped six sports to no. 9 . they remain no. 1 for another week .

title: This time at UCF, Scott Frost won't need to catch lightning in a bottle
content: Scott Frost is reuniting with the UCF Knights as their new head coach . the Knights are now in a power 4 conference, and there is now a 12-team college football playoff . he is a new coach at the university of central Florida .

title: 8 killed, 2 injured in collision between car and tractor in Bihar
content: the TOI City Desk is an indefatigable team of journalists dedicated to bringing you the pulse of cities across the nation, all day and all night . our mission is to curate, report, and deliver city news that matters to readers of the Times of India .

title: How Liverpool move on from Alexander-Arnold
content: mark Ogden wonders if Trent Alexander-Arnold's best chance of success on the pitch is at Liverpool . the 26-year-old has announced he will leave the club when his contract expires at the end of the season . he revealed he feels like he needs a new change and a challenge for him as a player .

title: Punjab Police recovers explosives, arms in joint operation targeting cross-border terror network
content: According to Punjab Police, the operation was carried out by the State Special Operation Cell (SSOC), Amritsar, based on intelligence inputs.

title: 14 arrested following clash between two communities in Pudukottai
content: According to police, the clash began over a verbal dispute at a petrol station between intoxicated youth from both communities.

title: Congress chief Kharge writes to PM Modi asking him to have dialogue with all political parties on caste census
content: Mallikarjun Kharge asks the Union government the follow the Telangana model, urges them to place the socio-economic data of each caste in public domain

title: Three youth drown in temple pond in Tiruvallur
content: The victims, Vedic students of Ahobila Mutt in Selaiyur, had gone to participate in the Brahmotsavam festival being celebrated in Sri Vaidhya Veeraraghava Swamy temple in Tiruvallur

title: In M.P.’s Duglai, a remote hamlet, unprecedented civic push follows a horrific crime
content: Duglai is located deep inside the forests of Balaghat, which was last month removed from the Union Home Ministry’s list of the districts “most-affected” by left-wing extremism and notified as a “district of concern”, suggesting that Maoist influence in the area is on the wane.

title: Rajasthan BJP leaders in Gujarat to attend training camp; Congress questions need
content: According to the party sources, the training sessions will cover the subjects such as the fundamentals of good governance, internal discipline and communication, public engagement strategies, understanding legislative procedures and effective dissemination of the government’s schemes.

title: YouTuber Shajan Skaria arrested on charge of telecasting ‘defamatory’ content against woman
content: The woman, currently residing abroad, had lodged the complaint against Shajan Skaria, accusing him of airing defamatory content

title: Sambhal ‘critical’ for BJP in all yardstick, says party’s organisational in-charge
content: Speaking to The Hindu, Pushkar Mishra, Organisational Election In-charge of the party said broader representation of all social segment has been the aim of the ruling party, pushing the West U.P. district as ‘critical’ for the BJP in all parameters.

title: Samyukta Maharashtra: how a linguistic movement built a State
content: Maharashtra Day has been celebrated since 1960 on May 1, along with International Labour Day. Looking back at the history of the formation of the State, one must acknowledge the contribution of Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe and Dr. B. R. Ambedkar

title: The implications of caste enumeration
content: While there is a vast political leadership who came through the lanes of OBC politics, there has also been a concentration of certain OBC communities in these spaces. The upcoming Census, with caste enumeration, could create a window of opportunity for the inclusion of those communities who have been left behind

title: Pak troops resorts to unprovoked firing along LoC in 8 sectors across J-K, Indian Army retaliates
content: Indian Army responded in a proportionate manner to the firing in areas opposite Kupwara, Baramulla, Poonch, Rajouri, Mendhar, Naushera, Sunderbani, and Akhnoor in J&K

title: UN Security Council's Tough Questions To Pakistan, Concerns Raised Over Missile Tests
content: the united nations security council came down heavily on Pakistan at a closed-door consultation . the members grilled Islamabad over the terror group's involvement in last month's attack . they also expressed concern over recent missile tests .

title: Internship for undergraduate students, mandatory under NEP, remains a challenge for West Bengal colleges
content: As the National Education Policy, implemented in 2023, a student can exit college at any time — after a year, two years, or after finishing the full course — but not without doing an internship

title: BJP’s Vanathi Srinivasan flags security concerns in Coimbatore
content: Leading a protest in Coimbatore to condemn the Pahalgam attack BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan criticised the Tamil Nadu government’s approach to national security.

title: Russian embassy invites Naveen Patnaik to reception marking victory in Great Patriotic War
content: The embassy said, among the heroes we pay tribute to is your late father, Biju Patnaik ji, a valiant pilot of the Indian National Airways who participated in the Stalingrad Operation

title: Trading in Bitcoin in India is refined way of doing Hawala business: Supreme Court
content: A bench of Justices Surya Kant and N. Kotiswar Singh made the remarks while dealing with a bail application of Shailesh Babulal Bhatt who was arrested by the police for alleged illegal Bitcoin trade

title: Assam villagers oppose transfer of wetland grazing field for logistics park
content: The Dorabeel Village Grazing Field Protection Convening Committee said the move to hand over the land in Kamrup district to a Kolkata-based company would affect more than 3,000 families

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: UNSC holds closed consultations on Indo-Pak tensions, hears calls for de-escalation
content: The 15-member UNSC did not issue a statement after the meeting but Pakistan claimed that its own objectives were “largely served”

title: Why should I face criticism for a few who indulged in riots: Mamata in Murshidabad
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister claims the Murshidabad riots were planned and promises to expose the people behind it soon

title: NHRC issues notice to Telangana govt over death of three workers in explosion at explosives plant
content: The incident took place reportedly on April 29 and the explosion caused the complete collapse of the mixing unit structure of the plant

title: As biodiversity threats mount, Forest Rights Act gives India the edge
content: At present, many international legislative institutions are recognising the crucial role indigenous peoples and local communities play in biodiversity conservation

title: Maharashtra BJP chief Bawankule urges party workers to ‘empty’ Congress, induct its leaders
content: On May 4, an audio clip of the Maharashtra BJP chief went viral, saying, ‘Bring people like Sangram Thopte into the party. Empty the Congress,’ he said while addressing local workers in a meeting held in Pune.

title: Caste census will resolve Maratha reservation issue, says Congress
content: Legislative Party leader Vijay Wadettiwar said that the Sadbhavna Yatra aims to bridge hearts and unite communities and fix the damage done by the BJP since 2014

title: Bihar polls will be the first test of the call to defeat BJP: CPI(M)‘s M.A. Baby
content: In Bihar, the party general secretary says the Mahagathbandhan alliance in the State has already begun united and serious preparations to achieve the goal

title: Odisha govt clarifies no timber from Puri’s Jagannath shrine used in Digha temple
content: A controversy has been simmering over allegations that surplus sacred timber from the Jagannath Temple in Puri was used to carve idols for the new Jagannath Temple in Digha

title: ‘Why such envy against Jagannath Temple’: Mamata Banerjee slams ‘baseless’ neem wood theft charge
content: The Bengal Chief Minister also expressed concern over reports of attacks on Bengali-speaking migrant workers in Odisha and said that they are targeted for speaking in Bengali

title: UNSC begins closed door consultations on situation between India, Pakistan
content: Hours before the closed consultations, UNSG Antonio Guterres voiced concern over tensions between the countries being at ‘their highest in years’, saying ‘it pains me to see relations reaching a boiling point’

title: Parachutes for uncrewed spaceflight of Gaganyaan mission flagged off
content: Developed indigenously by the ADRDE, the sequential system of parachutes is designed for Gaganyaan programme tests which are planned for later this year

title: India conveys concerns in ‘strongest terms’ to Canada after pro-Khalistan rally in Toronto
content: A large pro-Khalistan rally was taken out on May 4 that used terms like ‘Kill India’ and depicted several leading figures including PM Modi in a derogatory manner; the rally also raised slogans on religious lines and sought expulsion of Canadians of Indian origin

title: Detaining non-citizens and the rule of law
content: Assam’s immigration detention regime is not just a threat to the liberty and well-being of those caught up within it; it also raises important questions of constitutional principles

title: India carries out test of advanced underwater naval mine
content: The MIGM is designed to enhance the Indian Navy's capabilities against modern stealth ships and submarines

title: Miss World 2025 contestants to visit Pochampally on May 15
content: During their visit, the Miss World contestants will witness the tie-and-dye process that defines the Pochampally Ikat. T

title: Mapping process for scheduled caste communities in Karnataka focuses on ensuring ‘authenticity and accuracy’ using technology
content: After completion of the survey, the enumerators have to read out the contents and data that have been uploaded to the families, and get their consent to ensure accuracy

title: Speeding of bulletproof vehicle led to minor accident in Nadda’s convoy: T.N. Police
content: The Tamil Nadu police appeal to those travelling with VIPs not to pressure the drivers of bulletproof cars to speed

title: Delhi govt may hold meeting on May 6 to discuss preparations for mock drills
content: Measures to be taken during the drill include operationalisation of air raid warning sirens and training of civilians on civil defence aspects to protect themselves in the event of a ‘hostile attack’, govt sources said

title: More cyberattacks from Pakistan-based groups come to light
content: The ‘X’ account ‘Pakistan Cyber Force’ states that the group has allegedly gained access to sensitive data from Indian Military Engineering Service (MES) and Manohar Parrikar Institute of Defence Studies and Analysis (MPIDSA), defence source in the know says

title: Activists ask Centre to withdraw genome-edited rice varieties, say it’s unsafe
content: Venugopal Badaravada, a member of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research’s (ICAR) governing body representing farmers, said the announcement reflects a troubling trend of prioritising ‘science-for-headlines’ over ‘solutions-for-the-farm’.

title: Lufthansa, Air France, others avoid Pakistan airspace amid tensions
content: Pakistan’s overflight fee earnings are expected to be impacted by the loss in revenue, putting a financial strain on an already low on foreign currency reserves State Bank of Pakistan.

title: Jammu and Kashmir Government to respond to Sinha’s objections over proposed business rules soon
content: The Transaction of Business Rules is aimed at defining the functioning and jurisdiction of the Lieutenant-Governor, the Chief Minister and the Council of Ministers in the Union Territory

title: Akhilesh hits out at plan to use cow dung-based paint on govt. buildings in Uttar Pradesh
content: SP leaders alleged that such actions were aimed at diverting the attention of the masses, and hiding the failures of the State government

title: Four People Drown In River In Gujarat: Cops
content: Four people died after getting drowned in the Shetrunji river in Amreli on Monday, officials said. According to officials, the deceased were the residents of Mithapur Dungri village. Speaking to ANI, Gadhvi said, "We received information at around 8.30 pm that four youths had drowned in the Shetrunji river. Two rescue teams of the fire and emergency service reached the spot, and the rescue operation continued for 20-25 minutes...Four bodies have been recovered." The officials said that bodies have been handed over to the police department and sent to the civil hospital for post-mortem. Further details are awaited. (Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.) Track  Latest News  Live on NDTV.com and get  news  updates from  India   and around the  world

title: Family of captured BSF jawan hopeful of swap with detained Pakistani ranger
content: Hours after the terror attack in Kashmir’s Pahalgam, Pakistani forces detained the BSF constable after he reportedly dozed off under a tree in Pakistani territory along the international border in Punjab’s Ferozepur.

title: Comprehensive insurance scheme for KSRTC employees in Kerala
content: Employees need not pay premium for scheme. KSRTC will be fully computerised to allow passengers to buy tickets using UPI and card transactions on all KSRTC buses

title: CBI Director Praveen Sood likely to get one-year extension as selection panel fails to reach consensus
content: The committee, headed by PM Modi and having CJI Sanjiv Khanna and LoP in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi as members, met on May 5 evening at the Prime Minister’s Office

title: Tribal girls’ insistence on reporting gang-rape brings attention, development to Maoist-hit village in Madhya Pradesh
content: Officials of the district administration, police officers, and politicians have been visiting the Duglai village in Madhya Pradesh’s Balaghat district every day since the crime was reported

title: Jairam Ramesh cites Dhankhar’s comments to take swipe at Modi
content: “If the same money is transferred directly to farmers, then each farmer household in India could receive at least ₹30,000 per year,” the RS Chairman said

title: Collective punishment is not how democratic society responds to tragedy: Mehbooba Mufti
content: PDP leader visits Pahalgam, calls for fair treatment of civilians and seeks financial help for pony wallas ahead of Amarnath yatra

title: Pahalgam terror attack: India-Pakistan tension at its ‘boiling point’, says UN chief

title: BJP Northeast in-charge Sambit Patra meets Meitei and Kuki-Zo representatives in Manipur
content: Mr. Patra’s visit comes days after 21 Manipur Members of Legislative Assembly (MLA) wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, urging them to form a “popular government” in the State

title: Allahabad High Court disposes of petition seeking CBI probe into Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
content: The matter pertains to a plea filed by S. Vignesh Shishir, who had petitioned the court to order the CEC, the Chief Electoral Officer of Uttar Pradesh, and the Returning Officer of Raebareli to cancel the Congress leader’s electoral certificate

title: 3,000 SHG women to operate 700 Trupti canteens in State: MA&UD Minister

title: Post Indus treaty hold, India triggers untimely water release from J&K dams
content: While such release of water — called ‘flushing the reservoir’ — is a routine, annual activity and necessary to clear the dams of riverine silt and muck to keep the power plants linked to these reservoirs running optimally, it is usually done in August, during the monsoon.
